topic.title: Introduction
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server is a NoSQL document database for interactive web applications. It has a flexible data model, is easily scalable, provides consistent high performance and is “always-on,” meaning it can serve application data 24 hours, 7 days a week.

body.p: Couchbase Server 3.0 is a major release that provides significant enhancements to the following:

ul.li:
Performance
Tunable memory (option to remove keys and memetada from memory).
Bucket disk I/O ejections (for faster persistence to disk).
Faster warm up from disk when restarting the server.

Availability and reliability
Faster XDCR without persisting to disk on the source cluster.
Index building without persisting to disk on the source cluster.

Ease of administration
Incremental backup
Incremental restore

Security
Data and password encryption between client and server
Secure administrator access

body.p:
The Database Change Protocol (DCR) is an infrastructure enhancement.
For DCP statistics via the Web console, see DCP Queues via UI.
For DCR statistics via the CLI, see DCP stats via CLI.
